Issues.Title: strange appearance in text when Cell value start with number with text combination when Right-to-left enabled in DataGridView
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity2.visualstudio.com/t/strange-appearance-in-text-when-Cell-val/1289513)._ ---

Hi Team,

I have created a simple DataGrid sample contain cell values that start with numbers and text. in this case, applying the RightToLeft for DataGridView. its show strange appearance for Number start with text in cell value.

RTL applying in DataGridView code snippet for your reference,

dataGridView1.RightToLeft = RightToLeft.Yes;
dataGridView1.DataSource = new ViewModel(). Orders;

Replication procedure to reproduce the reported issue,

Step1: particular cell value set as Number start with text in DataGridViewDataSource. for example please refer to the below text,
Cell text like:"4 number and other text"

Step2: Run the Sample

Step3: The number starts with text cell value is a strange appearance. Please refer to the below screenshot for your reference,

Image:166561-strangeappearancenumber.png

The cell value starts with number and text when enabling RTL mode in DataGridView should properly show as "4 number and other text"

Sample Link: sample.zip

Can you please check and update the details as soon as possible?

Regards,
Vijayarasan

Issues.Title: ControlBox (maximize, minimize, and close button)  is not visible on MainMenu when maximizing child form
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.NET 5.0.1

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
 No

**Problem description:**

I have windows desktop application where the main form is MdiParent form with IsMdiContainer = true, and MainMenuStrip = MenuStrip.
When I open the child form and maximize it, the ControlBox (maximize, minimize, and close button) on the right side of MainForm-MainMenu is not visible, only when I move cursor on this part of MainMenu it shows very thin buttons.
With .Net Code 3.1 and the same settings, my application doesn’t have this problem, ControlBox is visible in MainMenu and normal size.
Also, this works with .Net Framework 4.8.

![dotNet3 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22772163/102506385-5374f780-4083-11eb-9477-5a93760844ab.PNG)
![dotNet5 0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22772163/102506400-5839ab80-4083-11eb-985b-87600d7c1d71.png)

Issues.Title: Fix "MaxDropDownItems" property for ComboBox in the DataGridView
Issues.Body:
Fixes #4373


## Proposed changes
- The issue is reproduced because "MaxDropDownItems" property does not work when the "IntegralHeight" flag has "True" value. As a workaround, the user can update the "IntegralHeight" flag themselves for the usual ComboBox and ToolStripComboBox, but the user does not have access to this flag in the DataGridViewComboBoxColumn and DataGridViewComboBoxCell. As a result, this property becomes useless for the ComboBoxes in the DataGridView. As a fix, we suggest to set "IntegralHeight" flag to "False" when the user updates "MaxDropDownItems" property of the DataGridViewComboBoxColumn or DataGridViewComboBoxCell. 

## Customer Impact
-  "MaxDropDownItems" property will work for usual Comboboxes and Comboboxes in a DataGridView

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->
- Manual

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->
- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19041.388]
- .NET Core 5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] when using up/down arrow or mouse goes through the comboBox list items, it switches to entire 'CB1' list node every time obviously in inspect tool
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 6.0.100-alpha.1.20615.5

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
Yes 

* More info
1.The issue can repro ComboBox, DataGridView ComboBox, ToolStripComboBox controls
2.The issue can reproduce on .Net SDK 6.0, 5.0 & 3.1.
3.The issue can reproduce .on NET 4.8, but can't reproduce on 4.7.2.
4.The issue can reproduce on all dropdownstyles: DropDown, DropDownList, Simple.
5.The issue can't reproduce ListBox & CheckedListBox controls.

**Problem description:**
In inspect, when using up/down arrow or mouse goes through the comboBox list items, it switches to entire 'CB1' list node every time obviously

**Minimal repro:**
1. Extract the attached application([CoreTesting4.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5701462/CoreTesting4.zip)), then build & run it.
2. Open the Inspect tool.
3. Go through the list items of comboBox by using up/down arrow or mouse.

**Expected behavior:**
Only focus on the list items when  using up/down arrow or mouse goes through the comboBox list items.

**Actual behavior:**
when using up/down arrow or mouse goes through the comboBox list items, it switches to entire 'CB1' list node every time obviously in inspect tool.
![NewIssue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/102327280-75f20c80-3fc0-11eb-9a61-ed46df2e04b1.gif)

Issues.Title: Fix NotifyIcon.Text limits text to 63 characters, but should be 127
Issues.Body:
Fixes #4361


## Proposed changes

- Change character limit for text in NotifyIcon.Text from 63 to 127 characters.

## Customer Impact

- This matches the Windows Control that was changed in an OS released before .Net is supported.  

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Very low, all tests updated and all supported OS's support 127.


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Update all tests to of this code to use 127 instead of 63


## Accessibility testing 
The underlying windows control supports 127 characters and the testing now uses 127 allowing the text to support longer descriptions.  

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- 5.0.200-preview.20601.7 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

Issues.Title: NotifyIcon.Text limits text to 63 characters, but should be 127
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 5

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes

**Problem description:**
Setting `.Text` on a `NotifyIcon` throws `ArgumentOutOfRangeException` if the value is greater than 63 characters. However, the limit for tooltip characters has been 127 characters since Windows 2000 (ref: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/shellapi/ns-shellapi-notifyicondataw#nif_showtip-0x00000080) and .NET 5 is not supported on anything prior to Windows 7 (ref https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/release-notes/5.0/5.0-supported-os.md)

**Expected behavior:**
No exception to be thrown for strings between 64 and 127 characters in length

**Minimal repro:**
`new NotifyIcon().Text = new string('a', 64);`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NotifyIcon.Text limits text to 63 characters, but should be 127" (#4361)

2. Set DropDownStyle = DropDown or DropDownList
3. Set MaxDropDownItems = 3

All options are displayed. Vertical scrollbar is not displayed.

Issues.Title: NullReferenceException when instiating UserControl as ActiveX Object
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 5.0

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**
I am experimenting with doing Office Addins without VSTO and using .NET 5. So far, I have succesfully manged to add ribbon buttons and I'm now working on a custom TaskPane, hosting a Winforms UserControl.

So far, so good. However, when instantiating the UserControl, an exception is thrown here: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/cb03d37fe73fb178d3c3827ad895bb3e7c50fe4c/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/Control.ActiveXImpl.cs#L841

_inPlaceUiWindow is null here and there is no check for that case.

Comparing to .NET Framework 4.8 reference source (https://referencesource.microsoft.com/#System.Windows.Forms/winforms/Managed/System/WinForms/Control.cs,17065), the implementation is different and I suspect that a regression has snuck in.


**Expected behavior:**
No NullReferenceException should be thrown.

**Minimal repro:**
You can download the project here: https://1drv.ms/u/s!AkwgkpetCvCpr4JeJeZfCGlKlHs4qA?e=PeB0So
You need to manually run `regsvr32 OutlookAddinNet5.comhost.dll` in the bin folder and register the addin in outlook:

```
Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Office\Outlook\Addins\OutlookAddinNet5]
"CommandLineSafe"=dword:00000001
"Description"="OutlookAddinNet5 description"
"FirendlyName"="OutlookAddinNet5 name"
"LoadBehavior"=dword:00000003

```

Then Open Outlook and click the [2] button added to the ribbon.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "NullReferenceException when instiating UserControl as ActiveX Object" (#4370)

The debugging guide should be more precise about how to setup a blank winforms project to debug changes made to the core libraries, using either VS or VSCode.

I suppose I should use a preview SDK to be able to compile the project, or create a custom global.json.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Contribution guide: explain how to debug changes in the project" (#4366)

Issues.Title: AccessibilityInsights' display about ‘specific item focusable’ on form is not correct when going through some list items for ComboBox/ListBox/CheckedListBox/TreeView controls
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 6.0.100-alpha1.1.20612.2

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
Yes, it is not a regression issue

**Minimal repro:**
1. Open attached sample app and run it in VS
[CoreTesting.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5694019/CoreTesting.zip)
2. Use Accessibility Insights tool to go through list items for ComboBox/ListBox/CheckedListBox/TreeView controls, and observe the AccessibilityInsights' display about 'which item focusable’ on form

**Actual behavior:**
AccessibilityInsights' display about 'which item focusable’ on form for some items are not correct, don't keep consistent with the list item we are focused by mouse or keyboard
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/102184760-ef1f3000-3eea-11eb-939b-6be9e46a4493.png)
![Issue1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/102184800-04945a00-3eeb-11eb-946f-98cb7f4c5752.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
AccessibilityInsights' display about 'which item focusable’ on form keeps consistent with the list item we are focused by mouse or keyboard
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AccessibilityInsights' display about ‘specific item focusable’ on form is not correct when going through some list items for ComboBox/ListBox/CheckedListBox/TreeView controls" (#4364)

Issues.Title: Control binding to data source is not working.
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: 
.NET Core Version: 5.0

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
 No

**Problem description:**
Binding a control is not working. Example, when attempting to bind a checkbox "checked" state to a my.settings property, the data binding dialog has no data sources to bind to and there are no options to create on.

**Expected behavior:**
Add binding to a control (example, checkbox) for state, text etc...

**Minimal repro:**
New .NET 5.0 project, added check box to the form. Navigated to properties, data bindings, checked. Dialog box shows no options.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Control binding to data source is not working." (#4362)

Issues.Title: ToolStrip position changed after minimize and restore of form
Issues.Body:
Hi,

all WinForms toolstrip's will move to the upper left corner when the form is minimized and restored.

The ToolBarBug.zip is a very simple WinForms solution to reproduce this beavior.

[ToolBarBug.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5679507/ToolBarBug.zip)

a) Run the WinForm application with the two toolstips on the form.
b) Remember the location of the two strips
c) Mnimize the form to the task-bar of windows 
d) Re-show the form from task-bar

--> ToolStrip positions moved.

I think this is not the expected behavior of the toolstrips. 

Kind regards
Sylko
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ToolStrip position changed after minimize and restore of form" (#4359)
